caption: The photograph depicts a forested landscape with the remnants of a recent fire. In the foreground, a morass of branches and debris is smoldering, sending tendrils of smoke wafting through the scene. The background is dominated by dense, tall trees, mostly conifers, which rise starkly against a dramatic sky. The sky itself is partially obscured by the smoke, giving it a turbid, greyish-blue hue. Some sunlight filters through the trees and smoke, creating an ethereal play of light and shadow across the scene. There is no visible human presence or artificial structure, emphasizing the raw and natural state of the environment post-fire. The overall mood is somber yet mystically serene, capturing the quiet aftermath of forest fire devastation.
title: In august, 1973 a major forest fire swept through 17,470 acres of the western slopes of the sierra mountain range near Sonora trees still burn on fringe of cleared area.  This part of the burn area is called "granite fire"
